website_summaries.verdict: In summary, the Asics GT 2000 7 Trail was able to meet runners’ expectations in terms of performance and stability. Some found the features of the shoe to be highly reliable, while some felt improvements were needed regarding how it fits. Despite the negative comments, the GT 2000 7 remains to be an average shoe that is still worth a try.
pros: One user wrote positively about the support and cushioning of the Asics GT 2000 7 Trail
Several runners noticed the durable yet flexible outsole of the shoe
A reviewer mentioned the shoe provided relief to their plantar fasciitis and neuroma
The design of the GT 2000 7 Trail was appreciated by many wearers
A lot of buyers appreciated the shoe’s performance during long distances
Some commenters reported a well-ventilated feel from the seamless upper construction of the GT 2000 7 Trail
cons: Some users are disappointed with the shoe’s limited width options
Others found that the sizing is too small
A couple of wearers encountered blisters while wearing the Asics GT 2000 7 Trail
A few testers reported that the collar is too tight around the ankle
The shoe’s lack of a rock plate is disappointing to some trail runners

customer_reviews.title: If you like kayanos and need some stability 👍🏼
customer_reviews.text: Fits right. I normally wear gel Kayanos but I liked the styling of these so I gave them a shot. So far so good. They’ve got enough stability and heel cushion to wear all day and I really don’t see how they differ from the kayanos. Shipping was quick. These may be a tiny bit wider in the toe than my previous kayano models which is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Double check sizing in person before ordering.
customer_reviews.text: I love the GT 2000 but can't figure out the width. Last pair I bought a wide because the previous pair was narrow in the toe. This time I ordered the normal width and the toe is good but the midsection is a little tight. Very good shoe but wish they would be consistent.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Echols

customer_reviews.title: Toe box made for maybe 3 toes total? Full size too small!
customer_reviews.text: The back half of the shoe is very nice with a good amount of heel support, but ASICs toe box and overall size has been terribly small the past couple of years. A definite change from what came before with their shoes. Be warned - these shoes feel like a FULL size too small. The same reason I moved on from Nike years ago, which means no more ASICs for me. 2 stars for size and disappointing build, but they do look great. And the Brooks Ravenna 10 was my alternate choice if you’re curious.
customer_reviews.author: ~Brian~

customer_reviews.title: Just Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Simply put, the most comfortable running shoes I've owned. Amazing on trails, dirt roads and roads. Amazing amount of cushion so feeling rocks or imperfections aren't noticed a lot. I will own another pair of these once this pair expires.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: iPhone several products from this brand, but my first model of this shoe. Overall the cushioning was average, in comparison to others I’ve owned. Are usually buy the Kayano model, which is more cushiony. The shoe fit very tight across the 4 foot, but did have a reasonable toebox. I would say overall for a size 14 it fits a little bit smaller than expected, which was probably right on since I usually wear a 13.5. I’d say this is good for an every day issue, but I wouldn’t expect to put a lot of miles on it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Trail shoe used as cycling shoe
customer_reviews.text: purchased this to use as my cycling shoes mainly since I don't clip in anymore. Perfect fit for me while cycling and comfort walking when off bike. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: ed

customer_reviews.title: 11 Year Old Boy loves them
customer_reviews.text: My son is 11 and usually wears a 6.5 in Youth but I bought one size large in the first size of mens in a 7.5 so he could grow into them. However...the larger size I bought him fits perfectly right now. I say they would run small. I wish I bought him an 8.5 instead. He loves them...loves how they feel...and wears them all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as previous product purchased from store. My second and third toe are just as long or longer than my big toe so i need a little extra room in the toe box. The mens size provides that. Great purchase. Recommend
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne Belcher

customer_reviews.title: Asics
customer_reviews.text: Shoe is just what I needed and expected from Asics.
customer_reviews.author: Master Chef Jr

customer_reviews.title: Problems with cushioning
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing Asics running shoes for over 30 years. I've always loved them. I bought the last three pairs from Amazon. The first one was the Excite model. That one was good and I still sometimes wear it. The last two pairs were the GT-2000 model. I received both of these and had to immediately go out and purchase cushioned inserts. They felt like I was walking on concrete. I'm not sure if it is just the GT-2000's or a larger issue. From now on I will probably go to a store where I can try them on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: they have resized them. order one size bigger that they used to be!!
customer_reviews.text: I have long skinny flat feet. worn asics for decades. last gel whatever they were gave out several years ago. screwed around with NB and others. finally ordered these and they are great. a nice stiff foot board which is what peeps with flat feet NEED. not overly padded so they don't feel like your walking joging in mud. well constructed as asics always have been. they're great. they just resized the things.
customer_reviews.author: officersmith

customer_reviews.title: That other shoe stinks... ASICS don’t!
customer_reviews.text: Good solid, long lasting shoes. Being that shoes seem more disposable than ever, a quality long lasting product is hard to find. Sketchers use glue that when it gets wet, the shoes instantly stink and that sour smell never goes away. ASICS on the other hand don’t. They are smell free and they are a much better overall quality product. I won’t ever go back to Sketchers.
customer_reviews.author: Jae N.

customer_reviews.title: perfect comfort
customer_reviews.text: I've worn GT2000s for many many, many years. Some fit perfect from the get go, some never got there. These were perfect from the start and seem to be very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, Great and Not So Great
customer_reviews.text: After a long break with Asics I went back to the GT-2000-07 and hit the trails. Great stability, great cushioning on the rocky or hard pack trails, not so great traction. Slippery on loose or wet trails. I would not run in them if on wet rocky surface. Just not enough traction. If your running on dry hard pack or grassy trails; great, if not your slipping and sliding.
customer_reviews.author: Cross Bearer

customer_reviews.title: Defective shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying the GT series of shoes for the better part of the decade I’ve probably owned 25-30 of them. This is the first time I have bought the trail version and I wish I never had, the fit and feel is very similar to the standard version but unfortunately this pair has fallen apart in less than 2 weeks of light use. As you can see in the picture the sole has separated from the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: Hurt my feet and legs
customer_reviews.text: The first time I wore these shoes the arches in my feet hurt and my calf and thigh muscles ached. There is a strap along the bottom of the sole that prevents your foot from flexing naturally. I ordered a pair of barefoot minimalist shoes and threw these ASICs in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Helmer

customer_reviews.title: Great trail running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! Not heavy but a great light trail running shoe! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Eye4Value

customer_reviews.title: Not like other ASICS I bought
customer_reviews.text: Not like other ASICS that I purchased. Cushion flattens out after long run and becomes uncomfortable. Shoe also not breathable causing feet to smell.
customer_reviews.author: renee

customer_reviews.title: Asics shoes are worth the price
customer_reviews.text: They were everything I was hoping for. They have great support for the ankles and padding on the bottom to make and all around great shoe. I also love the color scheme of these shoes. I haven't seen anyone else with them so that's a plus. I will continue to purchase Asic shoes because they fit my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Lucero

customer_reviews.title: Good cushion.
customer_reviews.text: Good for lighter trails but probably not best for heavy duty thick mud trails. I find it good for road too. Good cushion.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer R

customer_reviews.title: They're very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I love Asic sneakers they fit well. Never had a problem with them. I owe about 13 pairs.
customer_reviews.author: Raffy927

customer_reviews.title: Big price for such low quality.
customer_reviews.text: Fell apart in two weeks, just from playing disc golf in them. Profit margin is destroying once revered names. Will look toward products manufactured in the USA
customer_reviews.author: JSarg

customer_reviews.title: Defective tread glue?
customer_reviews.text: Asics trail runners have let me down several times, unfortunately. I've had troubles with the treads coming off on three different shoes now. This latest pair lost a tread on the very first use.
customer_reviews.author: lhseattle

customer_reviews.title: Solid shoe
customer_reviews.text: I prefer asics and like the solid feel of this trail runner.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford B.

customer_reviews.title: Shoe felt like a perfect fit  right out the box.
customer_reviews.text: Shoe was comfortable from the first time I tried it on. Feels great on all types of surfaces. My feet are on the wide side so the laces would have been perfect with a about two to 3 more inches.
customer_reviews.author: Ancil R George

customer_reviews.title: Best fitting shoe I’ve owned.
customer_reviews.text: I have big feed, but mainly they are athletic and wide at the balls of my feet. I typically have to buy a 1/2 or full size larger (too long) in order to fit in the shoe. These are perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Great fit for wide feet
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes, have held up great on the golf course and in daily life.
customer_reviews.author: VTgirl

customer_reviews.title: ASIC FITS are true.
customer_reviews.text: ASIC fits are true,. Shoe after shoe, the consistency is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: stu Maine

customer_reviews.title: Running the trails
customer_reviews.text: I am using these shoes for a combination trail and street running.
customer_reviews.author: PETER GONZALES

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes
customer_reviews.text: It is good as expected (I wear Asics for years). Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Vitali

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic read!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit, love the colors and shipping time was as expected
customer_reviews.author: Tom B

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I've been getting the GT-2000 model for years now and they fit snuggly. Great value for its price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: My favorite iteration of the trail GT-2000. On my second pair and enjoying
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: Great trail shoe. I have narrow feet and these fit well.
customer_reviews.author: Rhone Blanton

customer_reviews.title: WORTH EVERY  CENT
customer_reviews.text: I'M VERY PLEASED IN EVERY MANNERFOR WITH THE EXCELLENT FIT
customer_reviews.author: NORMAN B WHEELOCK

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but not durable
customer_reviews.text: I've been running with Asics for over a decade and have a lot of respect for the brand. It is the most comfortable shoe to run in. I bought this pair just 4 months ago. I only run 15k a week. I can't believe the lower sole is coming apart. Asics, please read this review and send me a replacement for Christmas. Much love, from a customer that never thought would be writing this review.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar A. Medina

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Best pair of sneakers I bought in a long time... I fully recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Daro

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love these for trail or road running. Ordered a second pair for the future.
customer_reviews.author: Stephan Frank

customer_reviews.title: Tight mid/ missed arch
customer_reviews.text: Good shoe. Solid. Super nice look. Good cushion - but the mid section is oddly tight. I thought that I had thin feet but the outside mid section feels like an arch support where an arch support shouldn’t be, continuously pushing into my foot’s inner ball and outer pad. I've put about 20 miles in these shoes with various inserts and am about to give up. Maybe it’s me, maybe its a previously occuring injury that was conjoured by a slightly misfit shoe, maybe it’s the shoe. Likely all of the above. Regardless, there is an oddness and pressure in the midsection that I do not feel in other shoes. I want to love these more than I can.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: Love them but they don't last
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd or 4th pair of Asics. I love them when I first buy them but they seem to last for me about 300 miles and they are shot. 1. I wear out the rubber on the bottom to the foam under the rubber and 2. They all develop a hole where the toe is and I've tried different sizes. Always along the seam in the same place. I run 5-10 miles weekly on average over the course of 9 months I usually am done. I do love them but my son runs more than I do with a different make and their tread lasts twice as long
customer_reviews.author: BillyMo

customer_reviews.title: Material failure
customer_reviews.text: Bought the first 6 versions of the gt2000s they were stable, long lasting, good shoes, my GT2000-7s came apart on the top of the toes with very little use, I used them as my dress uppers. I Ran in the older ones. Tried to reach ASICS but they have not responded.
customer_reviews.author: Tom T

customer_reviews.title: poor cushioning
customer_reviews.text: I've gone back to my older shoes to avoid knee pains. The toes box does stretch out after a while, though it seems to small at first.
customer_reviews.author: S. Elliott

product_meta.title: ASICS - Mens Gt-2000 7 Trail Shoes
product_meta.description: Easily transition from the road to the trail with the comfortable breathability, support, and grip of the ASICS® GT-2000 7 Trail running shoe. Predecessor: GT-2000 6 Trail. Support Type: Neutral to Overpronation. Cushioning: High energizing cushioning/Lightweight, flexible response. Surface: Trail. Differential: 10 mm. Heel/Toe: 22 mm/12 mm. Breathable mesh and synthetic upper with jacquard mesh technology that helps ventilate the shoe to keep your feet cool and comfortable. Lace-up closure. Discrete eyelets disburse lace tension for optimal comfort. Soft, plush tongue and collar. SpevaFoam™ 45 lasting employs 45-degree full-length lasting material for a soft platform feel and improved comfort. I.G.S® (Impact Guidance System) features linked components to enhance the foot's natural gait from heel strike through toe-off. Ortholite® sockliner provides excellent support and reliable cushioning for long-lasting wear. Dynamic DuoMax® System increases stability and support with reduced weight and enhanced platform comfort. Rearfoot & forefoot GEL® cushioning systems work together to better attenuate impacting shock and allow the foot to move fluidly throughout the gait cycle. FlyteFoam™ Midsole technology provides superior bounce back and responsiveness for any distance It utilizes organic fibers that help reduce packing out that can normally happen with softer, low-density foams. Guidance Line® technology employs a vertical flex groove that decouples the tooling along the line of progression for maximum stride efficiency. Guidance Trusstic System® integrates Guidance Line construction to enhance gait efficiency while promoting mid-foot structural integrity. HG10MM® Heel Gradient shifts body mass forward reducing the strain on lower limbs. ASICS High Abrasion Resistance (AHAR) rubber outsole is designed to give extra traction, keeping you stable and secure on any trail surface. Imported. Measurements: Weight
feature_bullets: FlyteFoam Lyte Technology - ASICS lightest weight midsole formulation that provides continuous cushion thanks to organic nano fibers.
SpevaFoam 45 Lasting - Employs 45 degree full length SpevaFoam 45 lasting material for a soft platform feel and improved comfort.
Ortholite Sockliner - Moisture management (Ortholite is a registered trademark of ATP Manufacturing LLC).
SpevaFoam Midsole Material - Improves bounce back characteristics and decreases midsole breakdown.
Rearfoot and Forefoot GEL Technology Cushioning System - Attenuates shock during impact and toe-off phases, and allows movement in multiple planes as the foot transitions through the gait cycle.
